alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Natchitoches; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 12:36AM CST until January 24 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, Bienville, Caddo, De Soto, Natchitoches, Red River and Sabine and northeast Texas, including the following county, Sabine. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Natchitoches, Milam, Many, Coushatta, Zwolle, Hemphill, Campti, Pineland, Allen, Pleasant Hill, Florien, Provencal, Natchez, Martin, Clarence, Goldonna, Hall Summit, Ashland, Fisher and Edgefield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
